txt.en: Continue work to sabotage both the Orc encampment and the hobgoblin encampment.
Place hobgoblin totems in the Orc encampment ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Work to sabotage both the Orc encampment and the hobgoblin encampment.
Return to Zóva.
Place Orc weapons in the hobgoblin encampment ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Took weapons from the Orc encampment ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'What is it?!'
'How dare you speak to us like that, puny maggots!'
'Wake up!'
'It's worse than that! The hobgoblins stole our weapons and destroyed our food while we were sleeping!'
Destroyed provisions at the Orc encampment ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'Lying filth!'
Took totems from the hobgoblin encampment ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Zóva, Prince Ingór's advisor, has devised a plan to further disrupt the Orkish factions within Gundabad.
Return to Zóva
Wait with Zóva and see if your plan works.
'Oye!'

'Good work! With the Orcs and hobgoblins fighting amongst each other once more, reclaiming Gundabad has become an easier task! Let us return to Prince Ingór and inform him of our success on this day.'
'No! You stole our totems and destroyed our supplies!'
'I'd like to see you try!'
Wait with Zóva and see if your plan works
'Raar!'
Mission: The Zhélruka Clan, Chapter 7
'Are we being invaded?!'
Take weapons from the Orc encampment ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'You'll die for those words!'
Destroyed supplies at the hobgoblin encampment ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Placed hobgoblin totems in the Orc encampment ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Destroy provisions at the Orc encampment ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Placed Orc weapons in the hobgoblin encampment ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Take totems from the hobgoblin encampment ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Destroy supplies at the hobgoblin encampment ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'The encampments are mostly asleep. You should be able sneak around as you execute on the plan.'
'Let us wait here and watch the encampment for a moment.'
Now to wait and see if your plan works!
'That will keep them busy and out of our beards for a while.'
